name: src/Node.js
Beginning
description: Avoids if-then-else logic when manipulating child nodes

name: src/PairingHeap.js
head
description: Find-min: simply return the top element of the heap.

name: pop
description:
Delete-min: remove the root and merge its subtrees. Various strategies
are employed.

name: push
description:
Insert: create a new heap for the inserted element and merge into the
original heap.

name: pushreference
description:
/!\ ref.next = ref.prev = null which means all references that are
external to the tree must reset .next and .prev and one must not call
PairingHeap#pushreference with an internal reference from this tree or
another, except the root of another tree.

name: merge
description:
Supposes the same comparison function is used in both trees.
We can call pushreference since other.min.next = other.min.prev = null.

name: increasekey
description:
Increase-key: remove the item at the key to be increased, replace
the key with a larger key, then push the result back into the heap.

name: delete
description:
Ref must be internal
ref.prev and ref.next get reset to null

name: src/decreasekey.js
decreasekey
description:
Decrease-key: remove the subtree rooted at the key to be decreased, replace
the key with a smaller key, then merge the result back into the heap.

unknown.tagValue: {Node} Returns the node containing the minimum key.

params.name: min
params.description: Current minimum-key node != null with .prev = .next = null.

params.name: node
params.description: Node != null to update with .prev != null.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value for the key of the node to update.

return.description: Returns the node containing the minimum key.

name: src/index.js
src/merge.js
merge
description:
Merge: compare the two root elements, the smaller remains the root of the
result, the larger element and its subtree is appended as a child of this
root.

/!\ Precondition:
  1. A != null and A.next = A.prev = null
  2. B != null and B.next = B.prev = null

unknown.tagValue: {Node} The input node with smallest key with .next = .prev = null.

return.description: The input node with smallest key with .next = .prev = null.

name: src/mergepairs.js
mergepairs
description:
Recursively builds a heap from an iterator of nodes by merging them pair by
pair.

unknown.tagValue:
{Node} The root node with .next = .prev = null or null for an empty
                iterator.

params.name: prev
params.description: Last node before first of list. First node is `prev.next`.

return.description:
The root node with .next = .prev = null or null for an empty
                iterator.

name: src/prepend.js
prepend
description:
Set B as the first child of A.

/!\ Precondition:
  1. A != null
  2. B != null
  3. A.next = A.prev = B.next = B.prev = null

return.description: The input node A with .next = .prev = null.

content: :cherries: [@aureooms/js-pairing-heap](https://aureooms.github.io/js-pairing-heap) == Pairing heap data structure for JavaScript. See [docs](https://aureooms.github.io/js-pairing-heap/index.html). Parent is [@aureooms/js-heap](https://github.com/aureooms/js-heap). ```js import {increasing} from '@aureooms/js-compare'; import {PairingHeap} from '@aureooms/js-pairing-heap'; let heap = new PairingHeap( increasing ) ; ``` [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/aureooms/js-pairing-heap.svg)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/aureooms/js-pairing-heap/main/LICENSE) name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[jspm](http://jspm.io)
or [npm](https://github.com/npm/npm).

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@aureooms/js-pairing-heap
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @aureooms/js-pairing-heap --save
```

name: ./doc/manual/usage.md
